keyword: how many calories are in a slice of american cheese
title: How Many Calories in a Slice of American Cheese?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in a slice of American cheese, including full nutrition breakdown, protein, fat, sodium, and quick variations for your diet.
h1: How Many Calories in a Slice of American Cheese?
assumptions: Standard processed American cheese slice (~28 g or 1 oz), pasteurized process cheese food, unwrapped and plain.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, slice thickness, fat content, and additives; check labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: One slice of American cheese provides ~90 kcal, 5 g protein, and 440 mg sodium.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories are in a slice of American cheese?
faqs.a: Approximately 90 kcal for a standard 28 g slice.

faqs.q: Is American cheese high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, one slice has about 440 mg sodium—nearly 20% of daily recommended intake.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in a slice of American cheese?
faqs.a: Around 8 g total fat, including 5 g saturated fat per slice.
Very few—about 1.5 g carbs and 0 g fiber per slice.

faqs.q: How does slice size affect calories?
faqs.a: Thicker or larger slices can add 20-50 kcal; always weigh for accuracy.
